question.title: jaxb generated java class needs same element name as in xsd
question.body:
Here is my xsd

<BatchTotalsQuery xmlns="https://transaction.elementexpress.com">
    <Application>
        <ApplicationID>12</ApplicationID>    
    </Application>    
</BatchTotalsQuery>

When I use xjc plugin to generate java class

@Setter
@Getter
@XmlAccessorType(XmlAccessType.FIELD)
@XmlType(name = "", propOrder = {
    "application"
   })
@XmlRootElement(name = "BatchTotalsQuery", namespace = "https://transaction.elementexpress.com")
public class BatchTotalsQuery {

 
    @XmlElement(name = "Application", namespace = "https://transaction.elementexpress.com", required = true)
    protected Application application;

XML getting generated as

<BatchTotalsQuery>
    
    <application>
        <applicationID>20</applicationID>
    
    </application>
</BatchTotalsQuery>

I want the application xml to be

    <BatchTotalsQuery xmlns="https://transaction.elementexpress.com">
        <Application>
            <ApplicationID>20</ApplicationID>
            
        </Application>
        
    </BatchTotalsQuery>

How can I add the namespace to the root and also have it as "Application" instead of "application"

Tried to generate using jaxb maven plugin and also from intellij

Once the java classes are generated I use the below code to send xml to vendor

BatchTotalsQuery query = new BatchTotalsQuery();
Application application = new Application();
application.setApplicationID("20586");
query.setApplication(application);

HttpHeaders headers = new HttpHeaders();
headers.setContentType(MediaType.APPLICATION_XML);
HttpEntity<BatchTotalsQuery> entity = new HttpEntity<>(query,headers);
restTemplate.postForObject("https://certtransaction.elementexpress.com", entity, Object.class);

question_comments.body: Which Jaxb library do you use? From which package do you import the annotations like @XmlRootElement?
